page.title: 02Eastbourne contd.
page.content:
Around St. Mary's Church and the Lamb Inn is the oldest part of the town. In Motcombe Gardens is the source of the Bourne Stream which gives the town its name. There are many tourist attractions like the{Treasure Island}playground, tennis courts, go-karts, a butterfly centre as well as the beach and sea. { {The Redoubt,}a Napoleonic fortress, has been converted into a museum and is also used for shows and concerts. Shows are also produced at the Hippodrome and the Tivoli Performing Arts Centre. Close to the Redoubt is the {Lifeboat Station.
Many elderly people retire to the town. Most of the new housing is at the eastern end of the town in the Langney, Willingdon Trees area.
